item.title: 6. Java Collections Framework
item.description: What “The Java Collections Framework is an interface-based architecture that provides optimized implementations of common data structures for storing and managing data.

item.title: 1. What is Functional Programming (FP)?
item.description: “Functional programming is a style of programming where we treat functions as first-class citizens, avoid mutable state, and write code that focuses on what to do rather than how to do it.” “Treat functions as first-class citizens” Meaning: Functions can be passed as arguments, returned from other f...

item.title: 2. Functional Interfaces
item.description: What Functional interfaces are interfaces with a single abstract method, which allows us to pass lambdas or method references.

item.title: 4. Streams - Intermediate Operations

item.title: 5. Streams - Terminal Operations
item.description: ✅ Interview-Friendly Script Terminal operations trigger the stream pipeline, producing results from all lazy intermediate operations.

item.title: Study Plan
item.description: Step 1: Understand Functional Programming Basics (1–2 days) Goal: Grasp functional programming concepts in Java.

item.title: 1. What is a Thread
item.description: Thread “A thread is the smallest worker in a program that follows a sequence of instructions step by step, and a program can have multiple threads running different tasks concurrently.” ✅ Why: “Smallest worker” → defines thread simply “Sequence of instructions step by step” → explains path of execut...
